docs.snippet: Airport officials and civil rights lawyers around the country are getting ready for President Donald Trump's new travel ban — mindful of the chaos that accompanied his initial executive order but hopeful the forthcoming version will be rolle...
docs.lead_paragraph: Airport officials and civil rights lawyers around the country are getting ready for President Donald Trump's new travel ban — mindful of the chaos that accompanied his initial executive order but hopeful the forthcoming version will be rolled out in a more orderly way.

headline.main: Airports, Legal Volunteers Prepare for New Trump Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Airports, Legal Volunteers Prepare for New Trump Travel Ban

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump was barely in office when he signed an executive order restricting immigration from seven Muslim-majority nations. There was not a moment to waste, he said, because any delay would allow the "bad dudes" to rush into the U.S....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump was barely in office when he signed an executive order restricting immigration from seven Muslim-majority nations. There was not a moment to waste, he said, because any delay would allow the "bad dudes" to rush into the U.S.

headline.main: Not So Urgent Anymore? Trump's New Travel Ban Delayed
headline.print_headline: Not So Urgent Anymore? Trump's New Travel Ban Delayed

docs.snippet: A draft of President Donald Trump's revised immigration ban targets the same seven countries listed in his original executive order and exempts travelers who already have a visa to travel to the U.S., even if they haven't used it yet....
docs.lead_paragraph: A draft of President Donald Trump's revised immigration ban targets the same seven countries listed in his original executive order and exempts travelers who already have a visa to travel to the U.S., even if they haven't used it yet.

headline.main: AP Source: Revised Travel Ban Targets Same Countries
headline.print_headline: AP Source: Revised Travel Ban Targets Same Countries

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's new immigration order will remove Iraq from the list of countries whose citizens face a temporary U.S. travel ban, American officials say, citing the latest draft in circulation. Trump is expected to sign the executive ord...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump's new immigration order will remove Iraq from the list of countries whose citizens face a temporary U.S. travel ban, American officials say, citing the latest draft in circulation. Trump is expected to sign the executive order in the coming days.

headline.main: Officials: New Trump Travel Ban Removes Iraq From List
headline.print_headline: Officials: New Trump Travel Ban Removes Iraq From List

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's travel ban has been frozen by the courts, but the White House has promised a new executive order that officials say will address concerns raised by judges that have put the policy on hold....

docs.snippet: The Justice Department wants a federal appeals court to put President Trump's travel ban case on hold until he issues a new order, but the states who sued to stop the ban want the case to move forward....
